level.heading: OCCUPATION OF THE PUBLIC RIGHTS-OF-WAY (ยง 24-3311)

level.text: All persons occupying the public rights-of-way on the effective date of this rule shall file a statement with the Director of the Department of Public Works on or before January 24, 1997 containing the following information:
The location and purpose for which the public rights-of-way are currently utilized; and
A statement indicating whether the person intends to continue to occupy the public rights-of-way after February 24, 1997.
If the statement indicates an intent to continue to occupy the public rights-of-way after February 24, 1997 the statement shall further specify:
The rates that the person believes are a fair and equitable charge for its occupation of the public rights-of-way, along with the justification for the person’s opinion; and
If the public rights-of-way are being subleased, the statement shall specify the rates, terms and conditions under which the person subleases the space.

Any trade secrets or commercial and financial information submitted in the statement shall be marked confidential and shall be held in confidence by the Department. Any non-governmental person requesting access to confidential information submitted pursuant to section 3311 shall first execute a confidentiality agreement with the person who submitted the information.
